sk.stuba.fiit.perconik.core.services

Class AbstractService

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.google.common.util.concurrent.AbstractService
      • sk.stuba.fiit.perconik.core.services.AbstractService
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    com.google.common.util.concurrent.Service, Nameable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AbstractGenericService

    public abstract class AbstractService
extends com.google.common.util.concurrent.AbstractService
implements Service
    An abstract implementation of Service interface covering service name and equivalence.
    Since:
    1.0
    Author:
    Pavol Zbell

      • equals

        public final boolean equals(@Nullable
             java.lang.Object o)
        Compares the specified object with this service for equality. Returns true if the specified object is also service and the two services have the same name. This definition ensures that this method works properly across different implementations of the service interface.
        Overrides:
        equals in class java.lang.Object
        Parameters:
        o - an object to be compared for equality with this service
        Returns:
        true if the specified object is equal to this service, false otherwise

      • hashCode

        public final int hashCode()
        Returns the hash code value for this service. The hash code of a service should be equivalent to the hash code of the service's name.
        Overrides:
        hashCode in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        the hash code value for this service

      • toString

        public final java.lang.String toString()
        Converts service to string consisting of its name and operational status. More formally, the returned string is a concatenation of service name, space and service operational status in lowercase enclosed in square brackets.
        Overrides:
        toString in class com.google.common.util.concurrent.AbstractService

      • getName

        public final java.lang.String getName()
        Returns service name.
        Specified by:
        getName in interface Nameable
        Returns:
        the fully qualified name
